channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Double yellow lines, 13th September
item.description:
The double yellow lines on lime grove are nearly worn off. It’s encouraging parking over them which is very hazardous. The lines need repainting. The lines on both the corners need to be lengthened as the corners are sharp/ blind and because of the parked cars on both sides drivers are forced to take the corners on the wrong side of the road. There are near collisions every day. Especially when their trees have their over growth at the grass verge. The lines need to be extended so you can approach the corners on the correct side of the road with clear visibility
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26A, Lime Grove, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction problem, 13th September
item.description:
At the junction of Millfield cottages /Close. As you drive out of the road into Sevenoaks way you have drive out on the wrong side of the road. There is a keep clear box but this is on the right. This needs to be replaced by a yellow junction box so that is safe to drive out without fear of collision
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Millfields Close, Poverest, London

item.title: Landfill, 13th September
item.description:
It seems that this section is cleaned once every 3-4 months. A dead fox, constantly broken bottles, moss that was not collected from the last cleaning, homeless people lived under the bridge, bushes were not trimmed. Unfortunately this place become so dangerous and neglected. Please check this area, not just once, because children go to school on this road every day, and what they encounter

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Babbacombe Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
